docs.snippet: Javier Mascherano and Pablo Zabaleta both played on for Argentina on Tuesday after being knocked down by blows to the head.
docs.lead_paragraph: Javier Mascherano and Pablo Zabaleta both played on for Argentina on Tuesday after being knocked down by blows to the head.

headline.main: Mascherano, Zabaleta Play on After Blows to Head
headline.print_headline: Mascherano, Zabaleta Play on After Blows to Head

docs.snippet: Brazilian fans began Tuesday's semifinal against Germany with high hopes, but Brazil was 5-0 down within 29 minutes, its World Cup dreams devastated.
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazilian fans began Tuesday's semifinal against Germany with high hopes, but Brazil was 5-0 down within 29 minutes, its World Cup dreams devastated.
docs.abstract: Brazil's soccer fans are still stunned by team's 7-1 loss to Germany in World Cup semifinal; Germany's five goals in match's first 29 minutes, more than many teams scored during the entire tournament, amounted to five gut punches for Brazilians everywhere.

headline.seo: World Cup 2014: Five German Kicks Felt in Brazilian Guts Everywhere

byline.contributor: Miriam Wells contributed reporting from Rio de Janeiro, Lucy Jordan from Brasília, and Paula Ramón from São Paulo, Brazil.

docs.snippet: While the hope was to blot out the bad memory of the last time the country hosted the World Cup, the outcome was if anything worse. But in a more mature Brazil, people are asking whether it will matter as much.
docs.lead_paragraph: While the hope was to blot out the bad memory of the last time the country hosted the World Cup, the outcome was if anything worse. But in a more mature Brazil, people are asking whether it will matter as much.
docs.abstract: Germany's World Cup rout of Brazil is vivid reminder of how the fortunes of host country's national soccer team can mirror how Brazilians view their society even as other traumas recede into history; humiliating loss stings for many Brazilians but others are trying to put loss in perspective and wonder how much it really matters.

headline.main: Brazilians Grumble and Take Stock After Crushing World Cup Loss
headline.print_headline: Brazilians Grumble and Take Stock After Crushing World Cup Loss

byline.contributor: Mariana Simões contributed reporting from Rio de Janeiro, Lucy Jordan from Brasília, and Seth Kugel from São Paulo, Brazil.

docs.snippet: Argentina and Germany were both back at work on Thursday, secretly hatching plans for Sunday's World Cup final as Uruguay striker Luis Suarez lost his appeal against his ban for biting.
docs.lead_paragraph: Argentina and Germany were both back at work on Thursday, secretly hatching plans for Sunday's World Cup final as Uruguay striker Luis Suarez lost his appeal against his ban for biting.

headline.main: Argentina, Germany Start Final Tuning, Suarez Loses Appeal
headline.print_headline: Argentina, Germany Start Final Tuning, Suarez Loses Appeal

docs.snippet: Neymar is progressing "very well" from the back injury that caused the Brazil striker to exit the World Cup, according to Barcelona.
docs.lead_paragraph: Neymar is progressing "very well" from the back injury that caused the Brazil striker to exit the World Cup, according to Barcelona.

headline.main: Barcelona: Brazil's Neymar Progressing Very Well
headline.print_headline: Barcelona: Brazil's Neymar Progressing Very Well

docs.snippet: FIFA has rejected Luis Suarez's appeal against his lengthy ban for biting an opponent in a World Cup match.
docs.lead_paragraph: FIFA has rejected Luis Suarez's appeal against his lengthy ban for biting an opponent in a World Cup match.

headline.main: FIFA Rejects Suarez Appeal Against Ban for Biting
headline.print_headline: FIFA Rejects Suarez Appeal Against Ban for Biting

docs.snippet: Uruguay forward Luis Suarez, banned from all football activity for four months and nine competitive internationals for biting Italy defender Giorgio Chiellini during a World Cup match, has lost his appeal, FIFA said on Thursday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay forward Luis Suarez, banned from all football activity for four months and nine competitive internationals for biting Italy defender Giorgio Chiellini during a World Cup match, has lost his appeal, FIFA said on Thursday.

headline.main: Suarez Loses Appeal Against Biting Ban
headline.print_headline: Suarez Loses Appeal Against Biting Ban

docs.snippet: Brazil's humiliating 7-1 defeat by Germany has left a deep scar on the World Cup hosts and highlighted the need for a football shake-up in the country, but it was not on the same scale as the "national tragedy" of losing the 1950 final, Sports...
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil's humiliating 7-1 defeat by Germany has left a deep scar on the World Cup hosts and highlighted the need for a football shake-up in the country, but it was not on the same scale as the "national tragedy" of losing the 1950 final, Sports Minister Aldo Rebelo said on Thursday.

headline.main: Brazil Sports Minister Says 7-1 Loss Shows Shake-Up Needed
headline.print_headline: Brazil Sports Minister Says 7-1 Loss Shows Shake-Up Needed

docs.snippet: A FIFA appeals committee on Thursday upheld the decision, which bars Suárez from nine international matches and all soccer-related activity for four months, for biting another player.
docs.lead_paragraph: A FIFA appeals committee on Thursday upheld the decision, which bars Suárez from nine international matches and all soccer-related activity for four months, for biting another player.
docs.abstract: FIFA appeals committee rejects motions filed by Luis Suarez and Uruguay’s soccer federation seeking to overturn or reduce his four-month suspension from soccer for biting another player during the World Cup.

headline.main: FIFA Rejects Suárez’s Appeal of 4-Month Ban
headline.print_headline: FIFA Rejects Suárez’s Appeal of 4-Month Ban

docs.snippet: Ana Tijoux, of Chile, and Danay Suárez, of Cuba, performed as part of the Latin Alternative Music Conference.
docs.lead_paragraph: Ana Tijoux, of Chile, and Danay Suárez, of Cuba, performed as part of the Latin Alternative Music Conference.
docs.abstract: Jon Pareles reviews performances by Ana Tijoux and Danay Suarez as part of 15th annual Latin Alternative Music Conference, series of free concerts at venues around New York City.

headline.seo: Ana Tijoux and Danay Suárez at Latin Alternative Music Conference
